answer:
In B.C., the inactivated influenza vaccine or flu shot is publicly funded (free) to the groups of people listed here. If you are currently living in BC and meet the eligibility criteria, you can get an influenza vaccine for free. Influenza vaccines are generally available starting in October/November and you can find a clinic near you here.
If you don't qualify for BC's publicly funded influenza vaccine program,  vaccines may be available for purchase from some doctors' offices, pharmacies (for those 5 years of age and older) and travel health clinics. Services vary across BC.
Immunization Nurse
question: What is the elegebility criteria for an Alberta to get the flu shot in BC?
